record.dc:title: 8BT21, 15BT21, Butler County, Kentucky. Annis Sand Mound. Sand mound or pile in square 170 L 6 and 170 L 8.
record.wpa:project_reservoir: Late Prehistoric Mississippian Sites in Kentucky
record.wpa:narrative: These subsurface sand piles with accompanying holes lying next to them were for some time a vexations problem when viewed from an archaeological standpoint. It was later decided that, since the sand in the sand pile showed no human disturbance, and was even shot through with heavy seepage bands that these phenomena must be geological, possibly resulting from the action of high river water in a low sand field. View from west.
